resources.string: GoogleSolutionChallenge2023
You have exceeded the set usage time. Let\'s relieve the tiredness of the eyes that have accumulated so far.
It\'s time to relieve neck fatigue accumulated during the day while looking at your smartphone.
STOP!
Thank you for your effort!
Let\'s turn the pupils clockwise slowly 5 turns.
This time, let\'s turn the pupils counterclockwise slowly 5 turns.
Let\'s raise the pupils up and hold them for 5 seconds. Then down and pause for 5 seconds. Repeat this 5 times.
Turn your pupils to the left and pause for 5 seconds. And let\'s turn them to the right and hold it for 5 seconds. Repeat this 5 times.
Press the eyelids with your fingertips for 3 seconds and then release them. Repeat this 10 times.
Take your eyes off your smartphone for a moment and look at an object relatively far away.
Let\'s put your clasped hands on your forehead. Put your hand on your forehead, and your forehead on your hand. Do this for 6 seconds, then rest for 3 seconds and repeat 10 times.
Place your finger under your chin and slide your chin up gently and hold it for 6 seconds.
Keep your fingers in the same spot and tuck your chin gently and hold it for 6 seconds.
Place your left hand on your left cheek and push for 6 seconds. After that, let\'s push the reverse for 6 seconds.
Hello blank fragment

When looking at a smartphone, if you use it while holding it down, it puts a lot of strain on your neck. Every time the neck is pushed forward by 1 cm, the load applied increases by 2 to 3 kg, which is a big burden and can cause turtle neck syndrome. Even if the turtle neck lasts, it can interfere with the blood and oxygen supply to the head, resulting in poor concentration or headaches. So, tuck your chin in and keep your ears and shoulders in line to ease the strain on your neck.

If you look at your smartphone for a long time, your eyes get very tired. If you look at your smartphone for a long time, you blink less, which causes dry eye syndrome and presbyopia in your 20s and 30s. Using a smartphone in the dark can cause glaucoma, so you should avoid it even more. So, blink frequently and look into the distance while using to reduce eye fatigue.

Using a smartphone while walking can cause an accident. If you use your smartphone while walking, your awareness of your surroundings may decrease and you may collide with others or cause a traffic accident. So, if possible, stop using your smartphone while walking.
It\'s time for a neck stretch!
Let\'s take a moment to relieve neck fatigue!
Send a daily neck stretching reminder.
Please set the usage time.
Set a warning message of eyes
It\'s time to exercise your eyes!
Apply
Set the reminder time
Start exercising your eyes
Set a warning message of a neck
It\'s time to exercise your neck!
N hour
Setting
Start exercising your neck
Set a warning message of a smombie
Using a smartphone while walking is dangerous!
Set the number of steps
